updates.update_content:
I got a couple pokes from some backers, an update is in order! 
I'm writing this update from Poland where we're visiting my wife's family for two weeks. 
Last few weeks have been a whirlwind of client work, and I shipped another 30 Bitties last week (up to backer #120, a bunch of two packs in that set!)

What's Nick do anyway?

Alright! We in three digits! Shipped backers #60-100 today!
One of the backers who received his last time, made this beautiful video running the Sunrise kit through his amp and some effects:
https://www.instagram.com/p/CNeZ-sEBVAt/
I've been preloading the Bitties with random favorite kits, but was inspired to preload this whole batch with this one :)
Except when people get a two pack, then I mixed it up.

Wrote an update on my phone on Friday and was surprised at the silence, just went to check on my desktop and looks like it disappeared into the ether.
So rather than rewriting I’ll let the pictures speak for themselves (long story short we’ve got an epoxy for the fragile jacks that works and looks decent - black)
No need to be careful with these. Everyone in the previous sets let me know if you have trouble.

A quick one with some feedback and warnings. 

Careful with the headphone jack!
One backer had his headphone jack rip off. For the backers who have one already, just be careful and insert the headphones/cable into the jack directly in and out. It's when it gets pulled at an angle that is the danger I suspect.

Alright friends! Another 40 have shipped, up to backer #60 now. This one includes the first ten Nite Modes too. Also first units abroad, one to Japan, two to the UK, and one to the Netherlands. Pretty exciting.

Now that I've got the swing of things, 20 a week is a reasonable pace. It's not as quick as I'd like, but everyone will get theirs without me having to bend space and time. My wife has seen my frustration about this and made a vaccine rollout comparison this morning that seemed like an appropriate analogy.

This is a quick one!
Some of the first 20ish people or so have been playing with their Bitties and have helped debug the Mac version of the desktop software, I just sent them the latest build Simon and I made last night (much more stable! doesn't crunch or cpu or freeze or any of that). Windows soon!

Well friends! I took the first set of Bitty boxes to the post office at the end of the day yesterday!
Bakers of the classic white bitty #1-21, your Bitties are in the post. More to come!

campaign.story:
Oceans is a 2-4 player strategy game in the Evolution game series where you create a vibrant web of marine life through millions of years of evolution. Whatever version of Oceans you pledge for, it will automatically come with a 5-6 player expansion.
The Evolution games are known for vivid themes, easy rules, and hidden depth. With many thousands of play-tests, years of non-stop design, over 100 unique illustrations, and more content than we've ever put into a game before, Oceans is our most ambitious project to date.
At the game's start, the only food source is plankton, the foundation of the ocean food web. It populates the beautifully illustrated Reef and Ocean boards, shown here as prototypes: 
(Note the fish tokens you see above are off-the-shelf items we used for testing. The actual tokens will be cardboard for the standard edition and acrylic for the deluxe edition. See below.)
Your goal is to create and evolve species so they find their niche in the growing ecosystem, by giving them helpful combinations of traits. This is a what a species looks like: 
Each species is defined by its population (the fish tokens above), and its traits (the cards above). Through the game It'll gain and lose traits, and gain and lose population depending on what it can eat, and what can eat it. Despite your best efforts, some species will go extinct! It's natural selection at work. 
Because you can build species from any combination of traits, thousands of species are possible, and they all interact in their own particular ways as the ecosystem builds. Every game creates a one-of-a-kind world, never to be seen again.   
Many species will be predators, each bigger than the next, all the way up to the dreaded apex predator. But some will eat in other ways, for example by scavenging on the sea bottom or filter-feeding on plankton. Below are examples of trait art - each a watercolor painting by famed nature artist Catherine Hamilton:
Then there's a whole other side to the game. It's called The Deep. 
Huge regions of deep ocean are unexplored, and what little we've seen of them can seem like fantasy:
We had to put this mysterious world into the game. Hence The Deep.
The Deep will contain, at minimum, 50 unique, powerful traits, which dramatically boost the range - and strangeness - of species you can evolve. We commissioned scores of illustrations from a variety of fine artists to make them. Here are examples:   
Through unlocked stretch goals, at least 32 additional Deep cards may become permanently added to the game. 
Beyond those, there are also 8 foiled Deep promo cards to unlock. These foiled traits are more aggressive and/or complex than the other cards in the game. 
With all stretch goals unlocked, you'll get more than 90 unique Deep cards in total. They raise the number of distinct species you can evolve from thousands to about one million.
Each time you play, there are 2 scenario cards in play (chosen at random at the start of the game from a deck of at least 25). Each creates a major ecosystem-shift when activated, altering the whole game. It's another way the evolutionary timeline changes each play.
The standard scenario deck can create about 600 distinct Ocean histories to evolve through, but we're also offering up to 13 more scenario cards as stretch goals. With those added, about 1500 Ocean histories are possible. 
We've packed all this into rules that are simpler, more intuitive, and easier to teach even than Evolution, which was already known for being easy to teach. Nonetheless you'll find tons of hidden tactics and strategies...under the surface. 
Note: Oceans is mechanically quite different from previous Evolution games. See this update for details.  
 For every pledge level, at the end of the campaign, you'll choose between English, French, Spanish and Italian versions of Oceans in the pledge manager. You can pledge for as many copies as you wish.
 North Star Games will publish the English version
 Funforge will publish the French version. Pour voir cette page en français, cliquez ici! 
 Schwerkraft-Verlag will publish the German Edition. 
 Ediciones MasQueOca will publish the Spanish version. You can read their updates about Oceans at their blog here.
 Pendragon Game Studio will publish the Italian version. To read about this campaign in, click here.
Standard Edition Pledge Level - $45 USD ($5 off MSRP)
You get the Oceans Standard Edition and all unlocked stretch goals. 
The Standard Edition contains:  1 Rulebook, 1 Reference Guide, 2 Player aids, 1 Reef board, 3 Ocean boards (2 small, 1 large), 120 Surface cards (10 of each type), 50-80 Deep cards (1 of each type), 24 Scenario cards, 24 Species boards, 200 cardboard fish with 6 different illustrated designs (see below), 4 Player screens, and 4 Bonus Score tokens. Note exact numbers of some components could change with final game tweaks.
The 5-6 player expansion contains 40 additional fish, 2 extra player screens, 2 extra bonus score tokens, and 10 extra species boards.  
Note: unlike in the prototype pictured above, the final cardboard fish will be illustrated on both sides: 
Deluxe Edition Pledge Level - $70 ($15 off MSRP)
You get Oceans' Deluxe Edition and all unlocked stretch goals. The Deluxe Edition improves on the Standard Edition in the following ways:
Includes 240 deluxe translucent acrylic fish tokens in addition to the cardboard fish of the standard edition, so you can decide how you want to play. The acrylic fish are more durable, easier to handle, and they refract light beautifully. Our goal is to make them as delicious-looking and as tactile as possible. We'll have done our job if your first instinct is to eat them. Prototype:
The final version may look even better, as they'll have smooth, beveled edges.
Includes custom-printed, premium food bags for up to 6 players for storing your points, instead of cardboard player screens. They feel super-silky, they have drawstrings, and they help keep your playing area neat and compact. 
Includes 220 custom Oceans premium matte card sleeves, for sleeving both the core trait cards and The Deep trait cards, plus spares. 
Box Cover Art Painting Pledge Level - $3000
You get the Deluxe Edition, all unlocked stretch goals, and Catherine Hamilton's original 12" x 12" watercolor painting for the Box Cover. Because the painting is one-of-a-kind, only one backer can pledge this level: 
Pledge levels which are no longer available
There are a number of pledge levels with backer limits that have been reached, and so are no longer available. To simplify this page, we've removed descriptions of these levels for now. We'll add them back in if any become available again.
Whatever language you choose for your game, your stretch goals will also come in that language. There are three types of stretch goals: 
 Deep Cards: Unlocked Deep traits that will become a permanent part of both the Standard and Deluxe Editions. Each card that isn't unlocked may be available on our website for $2.  
 Foiled Deep Cards: Promo Deep traits that are more aggressive and/or complex than normal Deep traits. After the campaign, each foiled card may be available on our website for $3 if there are any left over. 
 Scenario Cards: Promo scenarios that are wackier than the standard scenarios. Some are downright goofy. After the campaign, each scenario card may be available on our website for $1 if there are any left over. 
The total value of all stretch goals is more than $100.
You can order as many of each add-on as you like. Note the non-digital add-ons will add extra shipping cost, which will be charged after the campaign ends in our pledge manager.
Evolution (English or Italian) - add $40 to your pledge for each English copy, $35 for each Italian copy
Evolution is an award-winning board game where 2 – 6 players adapt terrestrial species in an ever changing ecosystem with hungry predators and limited resources. The game has been used in the evolutionary biology department at the University of Oxford and featured in the world's leading scientific journal, Nature. You'll be able to choose between English and Italian versions in the pledge manager after the campaign ends.
Evolution Video Game (English Only)
Add $12 to your pledge for a Steam code (20% off). In the pledge manager at campaign's end, it may also be possible to add-on iOS and Android versions.
We've turned Evolution into a video game for iOS, Android, and Steam. It's got lots of new content and modes of play, and a refined interface. The learn-as-you-play tutorial makes it perhaps the easiest way to learn Evolution.
Evolution: Climate Standalone (English Only) - add $60 to your pledge for each copy
Climate is a more advanced version of Evolution, where you must contend not only with other species, but also with a changing climate that can swing from scorching hot to icy cold, and major environmental disruptions like drought and meteor impacts.
Evolution: The Beginning (English Only) - add $25 to your pledge for each copy
The Beginning is a faster, simpler, more casual Evolution experience than its parent game. It's especially good for playing with young kids (8 and up) and it works very well for 2 players.
Evolution Foiled Promo Card Pack #1 (English Only) - add $12 to your pledge for each pack
This pack contains 7 copies each of 5 foiled promo traits that that can be used in both Evolution and Evolution: Climate. We normally sell each trait for $5 each (and not all of them foiled). With this pack you save more than 50% on each card. The cards are: Extra Sensory Perception, Cybernetic Limbs, Gigantism, Venom, Unstable DNA.
Evolution Foiled Promo Card Pack #2 (English Only) - add $17 to your pledge for each pack
This pack contains 7 copies each of 7 foiled promo traits that that can be used in both Evolution and Evolution: Climate. We normally sell each trait for $5 each (and not all of them foiled). With this pack you save more than 50% on each card. The cards are: Sharp Teeth, Rapid Mutation, Pest, Invasive Species, Pounce, Quills, and Last Stand.
Evolution Foiled Promo Card Pack #3 (English Only) - add $15 to your pledge for each pack
This pack contains 7 copies each of 6 foiled promo traits that that can be used in both Evolution and Evolution: Climate. We normally sell each trait for $5 each (and not all of them foiled). With this pack you save 50% on each card. The cards are: Mimicry, Trample, Timid, Insectivore, Coprophagia, and Claws.
Premium, Custom Deep Deck Tray by Dog Might Games - add $49 to your pledge
This custom Oceans card tray is crafted by the Viking Lumberjacks at Dog Might Games. Built to fit the Deep Deck, the trays are built using Culry Birch and feature the Oceans logo fully sculpted into the wood and Dog Might's custom Azul stain. The Trays measure 12 x 3.25 x 2.75" and fit both sleeved and unsleeved cards. Like all Dog Might products, the Trays come with a lifetime guarantee. North Star Games has been publishing board games for over 15 years and has delivered millions of games through retail and distribution in that time. This is our 7th Kickstarter campaign and the 4th campaign for the Evolution Series. We know what it takes to produce high quality games in large quantities and fulfill them despite the varied difficulties of international fulfillment, and we have time-tested systems in place which minimize errors.

campaign.story:
Suburbia is a tile-laying, city-building game from Ted Alspach, originally published in 2012. Suburbia has won numerous awards, is highly rated on Boardgamegeek.com, and is widely considered the best city-building boardgame of all time.
Suburbia Collector's Edition has been totally reworked from the ground up, with all new art, components, and additions. The fresh look of the design brings new life and amazing detail to your cities. The game features four sets of custom-designed Game Trayz™ with lids for organizing and displaying components. In addition, it includes all existing expansions and promo tiles and even a brand new expansion: Nightlife. 
There are plenty of Kickstarter exclusives: metal coins, a lighted start player marker, wooden interactivity markers, a themed tile set guide, and the ability to choose which 5 player colors (and as a result, which special city tiles and unique borough boards) you want to make your game one-of-a-kind. You'll also save $30 off of the retail version which doesn't have any Kickstarter exclusives.




This project is promoted by Green Inbox

campaign.story:
At Calliope Games, we are thrilled to celebrate our 10 Year Anniversary!  Over the past decade, our library of gateway and filler games have entertained, inspired, and provided an opportunity to make memories around the game table, and it all started with our flagship title, Tsuro: The Game of the Path.  We couldn’t think of a better way to celebrate this 10 year milestone than by returning to the series that started it all - so we welcome you to the launch of a brand new Tsuro game!
Long ago, a vengeful god stole the stars from the night sky. To illuminate the night, brave people released glowing paper lanterns toward the heavens. This act of hope summoned clever magical phoenixes, who soared through the sky and raced toward the lanterns. 
As the birds flew from lantern to lantern, their enchanted touch transformed the lanterns into brilliant new stars! Before the people's very eyes, the night sky became illuminated with beauty, all because of the firebirds.  The phoenix that creates a constellation of seven new stars will illuminate the night sky and once again restore balance to Tsuro...the path of life! 
In Tsuro: Phoenix Rising, an exhilarating new entry in the classic Tsuro series, each player is a phoenix, soaring across the board in an effort to reach glowing lanterns and transform them into new stars in the night sky.  The first player to collect seven star tokens wins the game!
Tsuro: Phoenix Rising builds upon the foundation of classic Tsuro – you must play tiles to extend your path, traverse the board, and be aware of your surroundings – but it adds exciting new features such as double-sided path tiles that allow for diagonal movement and can be flipped and rotated to choose your destination, as well as a revolutionary new molded board.  As a phoenix, you also have the astounding ability to rise from the ashes and return to the board once per game! 
All New Gameplay! – Become a phoenix!  Soar across the board, flipping and rotating the double-sided tiles to build your path on the revolutionary new modular board.
New Twist on classic Tsuro – Builds upon the foundation of Tsuro – create your path, stay on the board – but introduces exciting new elements such as set collection, strategic board manipulation…and the ability to rise from your ashes and return!
Exclusive Kickstarter Content! – Pledge now so you don’t miss out!  Kickstarter set comes with these exclusive items you won't find in stores later*:  
* Exclusive content layout and visuals will vary from those pictured on this page.  Exclusive items may be sold by Calliope Games at conventions or online but will not be available through standard distribution.
Every copy of the game comes with:
4 innovative game trays, which connect to form the game board
36 double-sided Path tiles 
1 Phoenix tile 
1 translucent acrylic First Player marker
8 Phoenix miniatures 
8 glass bead "ash" Life tokens 
7 "glowing" translucent Lantern markers: 3 Red, 2 Blue, and 2 Yellow
50 golden Star tokens
1 Rulebook
The Kickstarter Exclusive Set also features these upgrades and additional materials which will not be available as add-ons later:
And every copy of the game will come with these unlocked stretch goals:
Here's a closer look at some of the premium components included in every copy of the game:
Eight beautifully sculpted Phoenix miniatures
Seven "glowing" translucent Lantern markers in three shapes.
The unique patented tray allows one tile to be flipped and rotated without disturbing the others.
*Note that the final appearance of all components and upgrades may change. 
Tsuro: Phoenix Rising is built on the foundation of the classic game Tsuro: The Game of the Path by Tom McMurchie.  Some core gameplay elements remain, such as placing tiles and moving your pawn along the path.  However, as a Phoenix, your turns in the game will now consist of extending your path, moving your Phoenix pawn, transforming Lanterns into Stars, and scoring Stars to make a constellation!
For additional copies of the standard retail edition of Tsuro: Phoenix Rising, manually add $40 per game to your pledge.  There is no extra shipping for one additional copy.  To receive 3-6 copies of the game, manually add double the shipping cost. 
Pledge $20 now to be a part of the Tsuro: Phoenix Rising retailer program and receive your full margin plus 4 additional points for your support.  You may choose the Standard Retail Edition or Kickstarter Exclusive Set.  You will also have an opportunity to fill out your order with other Calliope titles at the same margin; FFA $350 (destination USA - See FAQ for details).  Retailer orders will be shipped with all other Kickstarter orders prior to standard distribution. Your final order and payment will not be finalized until the game is ready to ship.  Orders must be placed in case quantities (6 units per case); maximum two cases per location. 
Physical store verification will be required; you must provide the store name, store address, phone number, EIN number, and website or Facebook page. If you choose this option and we determine you are not a brick-and-mortar retailer, you will be charged the difference in price for one standard retail edition of Tsuro: Phoenix Rising after the campaign. No refunds will be issued. Result of the verification process by Calliope Games will be final.  
NOTE: International retailer copies will be shipped at the same time as all international backer copies; international freight forwarding may cause delays in fulfillment.  
The truth is, we packed all possible quality and value in the presentation of Tsuro: Phoenix Rising.  Upgraded tile thickness?  Done.  Fancy components?  Included.  Amazing tray?  You got it!!  So we can't approach stretch goals the same way other campaigns might.
Instead, we are going to treat stretch goals as a bonus for backers, to celebrate the entire Tsuro series!
Everyone at the Standard Retail Edition, Kickstarter Exclusive Set, Legacy of Tsuro, or Way of the Retailer pledge levels will receive all unlocked stretch goals when Tsuro: Phoenix Rising is fulfilled!  No additional charge or shipping will be required!  
A note about grouping multiple copies of Tsuro: Phoenix Rising:
Each copy of Tsuro: Phoenix Rising at the Standard Retail Edition, Kickstarter Exclusive Set, Legacy of Tsuro, or Way of the Retailer levels will come with one of each stretch goal item, so you can put together a group pledge and every copy will come with the goodies!  This also means retailers will be able to provide the stretch goal items for all copies!
We are offering subsidized shipping costs in order to strike the best balance of value for our backers and actual cost to us. We have strategically partnered with trusted fulfillment partners around the world experienced in shipping Kickstarter rewards.
*See Update #2 for list of EU Neighbor countries. 
The above costs reflect the Standard Retail Edition and Kickstarter Exclusive Set pledge levels; Way of the Retailer and Legacy of Tsuro levels may be slightly higher due to quantity of boxes to be shipped.  Shipping costs will be charged after the campaign ends through CrowdOx. 
10 years ago, Calliope Games began as a collaboration between Dawne Weisman, Jordan Weisman, and Ray Wehrs. All of us are experienced game industry professionals who have worked together since 1999 when we collectively launched WizKids. Calliope Games has been producing and selling quality tabletop games since 2009. Our products are inspired by family for families. To date we have released 19 titles, many of which were brought to life here on Kickstarter!
At Calliope Games, we publish fun, affordable, family-style tabletop games for all to enjoy.  
With gamers in mind, our games make the perfect "gateway" or "filler" game. They allow you to easily draft your non-gamer friends into your favorite hobby. Calliope games are excellent for starting out game night and are easily played between heavier games. It’s important to point out to our non-gamer friends that we do take a slightly different approach to the games we produce. At Calliope, we focus on entertaining adults; however, the games we produce allow children to compete with their parents without the parents “throwing” the game. It’s a really a pretty simple concept; instead of having the parents step down into the child’s world, we are inviting the child to step up into the parents' world.  
For gamers and non-gamers alike, the results of our efforts are games that are accessible by all players regardless of skill level or age, play in under 60 minutes, are affordably priced, and most of all… are a blast to play!
If you would like to add other amazing games from our catalog to your pledge, you may do so by manually adjusting your pledge using the amounts below.  The appropriate shipping will be collected post-campaign when the survey is sent.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With any venture, there are risks... those that are seen, and those that are unseen. The biggest foreseeable risks we currently face are manufacturing in China and shipping issues from China to our warehouse here in the US.

Each of these risks is greatly minimized with Calliope Games. Our factories have been with us for many years. They know how we work and the quality we expect. In addition, our freight forwarder and fulfillment teams are world class and have over 30 years of expertise to rely upon. If any issues arise, we will know of them far in advance and will be able to overcome them.

Upcoming tariffs may influence costs as well. Typically these are 10%-25% of our total manufacturing cost. Should tariffs affect prices, these will be reflected in the post-campaign shipping and fulfillment cost.

As far as the unseen risks... we know they are there and we have built a safety margin into our costs of goods sold to prepare us for the unforeseen. To date we've launched 19 games under the Calliope brand, many with a good number of reprints, and we have overcome all major production issues in providing our players quality entertainment experiences.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Celebrating 10 Years on the River.
In October 2008, an intrepid traveler made his way through the jungles and ancient ruins of South East Asia. From fevered sketches in dog-eared notebooks, the idea for a pulp horror adventure board game was born.
To celebrate the 10th year of the conceptual birth of Ancient Terrible Things (ATT), and to coincide with the re-print of a rare expansion, Pleasant Company Games presents a 14-day Kickstarter campaign for backers new and old. 
For those ready to complete their ATT collections, and for those new to the rusting riverboat, welcome to the journey and celebration of the cult pulp horror dice-chucker!
Sketches, photos and exploration; circa 2008
Why Kickstarter?
Over the years we have developed a strong community of followers on the Kickstarter platform, and we see Kickstarter as being the natural place to celebrate this milestone. Though Ancient Terrible Things is available from selective retailers in the US and EU, the products can be hard to find in the rest of the world. 
Stretch goals
This campaign does not feature stretch goals, as the the campaign is geared towards offering re-printed and existing content to new and existing backers. 
Limited quantities
The campaign will run for 14 days with limited copies available in each tier level. 
Quantities will be adjusted dynamically in each tier level to accommodate overall reprint quantities (500 for the Lost Charter) and available stock (500 ATT base game).
All products for this Kickstarter campaign are shipped from the USA, and may be subject to customs compliance in the destination country.
What would a Kickstarter campaign be without exclusive content. AwakeTen KS campaign includes a printable digital wallpaper of the new dice-tray artwork in The Lost Charter 2nd Impression printing, for all pledge levels and  a limited edition promo Encounter card for all backers at Colonel pledge level ($15+) or higher.
 Ancient Terrible Things (2014) is the original Dicequest tabletop game. Set on a jungle river, explorers travel by riverboat to uncover Ancient Secrets. Along the way they will face Pitfalls, Villains, Horrors and Artefacts - all which award fame and madness. The core game features 104 unique cards, 11 translucent dice, game board of the river with its Fateful Locations, 144 tokens, wooden pawns and player boards.
Ancient Terrible Things: The Lost Charter (2015) was the first expansion for ATT and has been out of print for a few a years. As part of this KS campaign, Pleasant Co. Games will be re-printing 500 copies of the expansion.  The Lost Charter introduces travel-friendly cards for all the Locations, solo rules, a 5th playable character, 2 new purple Revelation dice and new game mechanics, including Foreshadowing, Trade Offers and Character Obsessions.
Ancient Terrible Things: Madness of McGuffin (2017) is the latest mini-expansion for ATT. With the release of Konja(2017), the second game to feature the Dicequest game system as used in Ancient Terrible Things, the designer introduced a streamlined re-roll system and  resource dice to the game.
These changes have been introduced to ATT through the Madness of McGuffin expansion, which includes two Starting Swag cards for each of the four principle characters in ATT. Along with new white Resource dice and a full set of translucent custom Skullpip dice, the  expansion adds new ways to play with extra atmosphere and suspense.
McGuffins' Mask is activated with a white die and two Focus tokens to re-roll two dice. The swag card is then exhausted until the end of the turn.
Final dice are spent to acquire resources, and the remaining white resource die is converted to a Focus token.

Dear Traveller,
Among the many arcane possessions found near the scene, an un-opened parcel that rattled with mystery. Bones of fate await.
As we enter the silly season, many of you may be rushing to finish up the year's projects and admin. It is nice to know that something good awaits in the postal system.

Dear Traveller,
It may not be shiny metal, but the wealth of eons is contained in this precious cargo.
But beware, madness lurks within them packing boards...
We have reached the final bend in this river, and are happy to inform you that the pledge manager for this Kickstarter campaign will be going live imminently.

Dear Traveller,
It is good to see you back to good health.
The concerns about your whereabouts on that dastardly of rivers had the lady of the house reaching for the salts. Tell us of tales from faraway places...
To kickstart our first post-campaign update, let us begin with a huge thank you to all our backers new and old for joining the celebration. It was wonderful to see such a warm response for our horrible pulpy 10-year old.

updates.update_userinfo: Dust has settled after the carnival of games.
updates.update_content:
Dear Traveller,
Our time together grows short. Soon I fear you will not longer recognize friend or foe - I have seen that haunting in the eyes of many a foolhardy adventurer before you. This is not a place for people of your world - this is a place far more primordial.
All these twists in the river have allowed for a duplicate in our countdown, and there appears to be two Day 7's. So this is actually, Day 10, or the last day of our 10 years... The last project of ATT was the Madness of McGuffin, a simple riff on the key cards of Konja, as well as custom dice for both games. The iconography on the resource dice worked across both games, as I had intentionally conceptualised that key resources in the game system would have a universal trait that could transcend genres to a point. I realised that a good game system is something that needs to be nurtured and iterated, and the future of ATT will be sure to bring new adventures and surprises.

It's the year 3030, and technology offers humankind unimaginable entertainment. What used to be virtual reality is now reality, and sports that once occupied your flat-screen now occupy the world stage. The largest of them embodies the evolution and integration of athleticism and machinery. Once every five years, hundreds of millions of viewers tune in to witness the spectacle that is M.E.C.H.s: Mechanized Entertainment Combat Heroes.
Suit up your Meeples for the ultimate battle royale with...
Some items displayed are stretch goals and will need to be unlocked.
The amazing ITEMeeples are snapped into your Mech when you earn it in play!
Motion GIF may take a moment to load.
Tiny Epic Mechs is an arena-style player-vs-player action-programming game. It features ITEMeeples with plastic molded power armors and a Mech suit that the ITEMeeples actually go inside of. 
In Tiny Epic Mechs, players take on the roles of highly skilled and athletic Mech pilots. 
They compete in a free-for-all battle royale over the span of six rounds. In each round, players select four of eight available actions to program. 
These actions keep you moving around the arena while allowing you to deploy high-scoring defensive turrets, plant explosive land mines with hidden values, collect resources, purchase weaponry, and power up into your Power Armor or eventually the highly-sought-after Mech Suit. While each player has their own Power Armor, there is only one Mech Suit, reserved for the king of the hill. 
Your programmed actions are played out one at a time around the table until all players have executed their four actions. When you cross paths with another player, combat ensues. During combat, players exchange fire until one player is out of ammo and must retreat, or they are defeated and forced to reset. 
Combat is fast, and you can use each weapon only one time per fight, so the more weapons you have, the longer you'll last. Weapons are categorized into three types, and each type counters one of the other types. If you time your weapons correctly, you can counter your opponent and unleash a more powerful attack and gain an edge over them. Dealing a lot of damage to your opponent will wow the audience and earn you lots of points, which brings you closer to victory. You also score victory points every other round based on area control and who controls the Mech. At the end of the game, you also earn points for each weapon you own.

The publication of a board game is a highly involved process. It can be prone to many mistakes and delays, even for experienced publishers.

We're proud to say that we are prepared for the task at hand and have years of experience in successfully producing board games and fulfilling Kickstarter projects.

Here are the steps we take to prepare and reduce the likelihood of mistakes and delays:

1. We have done significant pre-production. This includes having all the illustrations for the game complete and the graphic art over 95% complete. The production quote is in hand and ready to be initiated.

2. We are working with an experienced manufacturing partner. We are familiar with their production requirements, timelines, payment schedules, communication methods and Chinese freight arrangements and costs for when it comes time for shipping. We will provide tracking information for the boat when the games leave China.

3. We are working with an experienced fulfillment partner. We are confident that they can handle any amount of work we send their way. They have fulfilled many projects and have proven to be communicative, punctual and respectful when dealing with our customers.

Above all, I am 100% dedicated to backer communication. I will be transparent with our process and involve our backers as much as possible. I will be present daily during the project to answer any questions and I read every comment. I will provide regular updates and supply photos of the progress.

campaign.story:
After a successful bank heist, you and your fellow thieves are laying low and enjoying the good life. Most of the cash has been hidden away, and the rest has been invested in businesses throughout the city. Everything is going according to plan until the police get a breakthrough in their investigation. Accusations are made, fingers are pointed, and after a heated argument, you decide to go your separate ways. Chaos ensues as the SWAT team is called in and starts to close off the city’s exits. Your only choice now is to escape the city before it is completely locked down. But you need a plan — a good route that allows you to leave the city while recovering as much of the money as possible.   
You will need to call in some favors and hire the local gangs to create diversions. Bribing the Police would be a good idea too, but it isn't cheap. Disguises may help, but they don’t fool everyone. Setting the Police on the trail of your former colleagues will give you a better chance of escape, but the other thieves are thinking the same thing.  
Will you escape the city with the most money, or will the Police lock down the city before you can escape?
In Escape Plan, players are the thieves, but they may influence the cops' moves every turn. The robbers move on a modular board trying to reach the best spots to recover their loot and escape from the city with more money than the other thieves. The cops are trying to thwart their escape plan — by force if necessary. The players play cards to aid their escape and slow the other players down. The players take actions that allow them to move and to engage gangs, mules, and snitches.  
Players use hidden asymmetric goals to recover the maximum amount of cash during the game while avoiding the police. The players' roles as thieves are individual with every player for themselves. In the end, only the player who escapes with the most cash wins.

Risks and challenges
Eagle-Gryphon Games has completed 75+ Kickstarter projects to date. All of those projects have either been completely delivered or are in production right now.

Eagle-Gryphon Games stands by our products. Please contact our customer service department at customer-service@eagle-gryphon.com within 30 days of receiving your pledge reward(s) if you are for any reason unsatisfied. We will take every step available to get you exactly what you purchased. We will also send you tracking information whenever possible to remain transparent throughout the delivery of your purchase.

We will always do our best through Kickstarter updates to keep you as informed as possible as to the status of your game(s). However, in this business some uncertain factors are beyond our control, such as holidays, customs, quality control, inspection delays, inclement weather and dock strikes - to name a few. Please understand we have little to no control over such factors. We assure you that you will be the first to know any developments as we learn them.

Put simply: you will get everything we promise to you when you pledge to one of our Kickstarter projects, and it will be delivered to you in as timely a manner as possible.

We reserve the right to combine the shipping of any and all pledges for multiple projects if the shipping runs close to the same time and we can ship them all within a reasonable time frame (30 days) of us receiving them. We will advise you as soon as possible if it looks like we will delay shipping for this reason. You will always have the right to pay additional fees to get expedited delivery on orders.

Shipping issues are relatively uncommon, but they do sometimes occur. We double check all of your games for damage before sending them to you. However, there is a small chance that your games may get damaged during shipping by the carrier. If your package is damaged, please contact us so we can assist you.

updates.update_content:
Portugal, the Canary Islands, and Australia
11 backers from Portugal and 2 backers from the Canary Islands are awaiting their pledges according to the report I have received. We've recently learned that the shipment to Spain with the pledges for these 13 backers was held up at Customs.  We are working to have that remedied as soon as possible so that these pledges can be sent out.

EU: 
The remaining games were sent from the Netherlands to Meeple Logistics on Thursday of last week. Meeple Logistics are now sending these out to the backers. Most of you should have received a tracking number by now. 
Some of the lucky backers who have already received their games have discovered minor problems. With this quantity of games there are inevitably a few cases of missing meeples or various other items. Once fulfillment has been completed Meeple Logistics will be sending any needed replacement parts, although you should send such requests to me to be passed along to them. Any problems with games other than Escape Plan will be rectified by our US warehouse. BoardGameGuru will be sending replacements in the UK.

AUSTRALIA
We must apologize profusely to our Australian Backers for the lack of communication from us to you. We have only this past week found out that the shipment we made from China to Australia in mid-April was missing stock that we had asked to be included on that shipment. As a result, Aetherworks simply does not have enough copies of Escape Plan, The Gallerist, The Gallerist expansions, Vinhos Deluxe expansions, Lisboa Deluxe, and metal coins needed to complete fulfillment of all the Australian orders. We are asking them now to send out what they have on hand. This means that a few of you will get your complete order; some of you will get a partial fulfillment and still others will get nothing. We realize that this will not be good news to some of you, but all we can do is apologize and try to get on top of the situation as best we can -- now that we know what the problems are.

Hello backers,
I want to thank those that have been patiently waiting for their packages.  To those that have received their packages, I hope you are enjoying the game. To those that have had any issues, I want you to know that we aim to resolve everything we can for you as soon as possible.
Missing the Time Token?
Our friends at Heavy Cardboard will be hosting a live Teach & Play-Through of Escape Plan tonight at 7pm EDT:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wxnhfbltIA0

campaign.story:
Unfair is a unique tableau-building theme park game filled with humourously cynical challenges and strategies. This Unfair expansion brings four new themes to take its replayability through the roof. Mix them with your old favourites, or with each other to discover all new strategies to master in this thrill ride of a game.
Look out for the Late Pledge button after the campaign ends.
 More details in the Stretch Goal section later in the page.
This expansion adds even more replayability to the Unfair base game. With the base game alone, there are 15 combinations of themes for a 4 player game - throw in the expansion and that goes up to over 200!
Aliens have arrived, but they assure us they only want to serve humanity. Help with their research projects and they offer Alien Influence in return, a new type of currency worth 2 points each at game end.
 You can earn Alien Influence by building attractions and upgrades so the aliens can observe us in our natural environment. These are marked with an Alien Influence symbol in place of a star.
Then use your accumulated influence with the aliens to build advanced technology to improve your park - the price is marked on the pricetag.
Be careful! If any staff should happen to get any Alien Influence on themselves, they will disappear mysteriously at the end of the round, shuffled back into the Park deck!
B-movie enables scoring for building panoramas, including those in the base game's 6 themes. With a little effort, some spectacular scenes are possible.
B-movie adds some useful new features to help you build the right attractions in the right order to complete your panorama.
Mashing up themes on the same attraction can have all kinds of benefits... 
 ... all to help you make movies so awful they're awesome.
Discover a mysterious valley filled with living dinosaurs, offering exciting new ways to draw a crowd... for a park owner willing to take the risk.
Add live dinosaurs to your park! With high stars and low cost, they come with enclosures that are just barely adequate, so each round you must roll to determine if they rampage.
You can build electrified fences to properly contain them, or use some careful risk management to keep them under control.
If your park is all about dinosaurs you can enhance guest security, or turn it into an island, using a new type of Showcase card - the replacement park entrance.
The Old West offers wide open spaces, big projects, sudden riches... and robbery. Quality upgrades represent gold nuggets in this theme pack - discovered, dug up, and spent to improve the frontier town in your park.
With an extra lot in your park, you finally have space to build more than 5 attractions. You can even build two super attractions at once!
The Western theme doesn't turn on panorama scoring by itself, but when played with a theme that does, like B-movie, the Western panorama cards can be placed in any order to make for some awesome vistas.
The sheriff is tough but fair, but even he can't keep the local bandits completely under control
                                                               Don't like being hounded by the city and their Unfair City cards? Now you can make yourself immune by accepting the Djinni's Bargain.
Prefer to limit demolitions in your park, but without stopping all interactions entirely? You need better Building Insurance!
How about some warning of what the city plans to do to you? A little Prescience will let you peek at the future.
More variety in your 2-player games? Just add One For The Pot.
Play these in combination with other game changers to tweak the play style to suit your group's preference.
Components - ABDW expansion:
262 cards in total featuring 111 new illustrations
4 new theme packs of 57 cards - Alien, B-movie, Dinosaur, Western
4 new Game Changer cards 
30 Alien Influence tokens, in values of 1, 3, 9
8 Insurance Excess tokens (for use with the Building Insurance game changer)
1 Dinosaur Rampage reminder marker
1 Alien Abduction reminder marker
32 page narrow-format rulebook
Package: Base game + ABDW expansion
The cover for this expansion joins onto the base game box to create a panoramic scene, and future expansions will extend the scene even further.
Specifications:
Cards: 300gsm black core stock, matte lamination, round corners.
Box: 12" x 5.3", 2mm greyboard, matte lamination.
Tokens: 2.5mm greyboard, matte finish.
 Read Neil's full review on BGG here
Listen to The Dicemen Cometh podcast episode here 
The Unfair base game reached all of its stretch goals, including upgrades to card stock and token thickness, so this expansion for Unfair starts pre-stretched with those same features.

In the base game campaign, we were able to add two extra theme packs as stretch goals. That was possible because we had been working on the game for five years beforehand.

This time we have a number of stretch goals to reveal, but we need to warn you that none of them is on the scale of an extra theme pack.
We pre-pack Unfair in a robust mailer box at the factory, and use quality fulfillment companies in each region to stay tax free for backers and keep shipping costs as low as possible globally.
USD$12 for shipping is included in the Expansion pledge tier, and USD$17 in the Unfair + Expansion pledge tier. Backers in some regions will need to pay additional fees in these ranges:
Unfair is the beautiful and lovingly cynical brainchild of designer Joel Finch. The original base game was literally a 5 year labour of love, designed in no small part because his stupendously fabulous wife Kate wasn't interested in playing Magic the Gathering with him.
The Unfair world is a contrast of pure theme park fun, happy childhood memories, and blue skies...
...and the gritty, impersonal, sometimes nasty world of commerce. What do people say while they knife their competitors? It's just business...
This first expansion sees the addition of four theme packs that complement the original set. Development of these four themes has taken place over the last four years, with worldwide blind playtesting beginning in December 2017.
The original 6 themes provided 15 possible combinations for a 4-player game. With the 4 new themes, that total increases to over 200 possible combinations!
The game looks mostly finished - so why do we need Kickstarter?
Unfair's large number of deluxe illustrations mean it has a high art cost relative to its sale price, and success at Kickstarter is the way we can recoup that. Without Kickstarter, the budget for art would be significantly lower, and we would need to have fewer unique pieces and/or accept lower detail for many of them.
Success at Kickstarter also helps us to recoup the costs more quickly than sales through retail, so funds can be applied to future development immediately, speeding up the timeline for upcoming expansions. Which is handy, because we have plans underway to fill out the alphabet with a range of new themes and mechanics.

We can get more eyes on the final result *before* it goes to print, which helps to improve the quality. The base game was improved in many details by the feedback of backers during the Kickstarter campaign, and we hope you can help us there again.
Using Kickstarter also allows us to improve the result over the minimum retail product by adding stretch goals, and have a little fun with a few sneak peeks of future packs that we wouldn't be able to justify otherwise.

In short, with your help through Kickstarter, we can make games more awesome.
Over 250 playtesting groups provided feedback to help improve and polish this expansion. Thank you to you all!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 3rd Kickstarter project. 

Our artists have proven very reliable and we have confirmed they can complete the listed stretch goal card illustrations by the end of this campaign, and we won't be pushing them beyond that.

Rules are complete and formatted, and only need final blue-ink commentary from our resident grumpy former theme park owner.

Backers' games will be pre-boxed in shipping boxes at the point of manufacture for faster and more consistent shipping. They will feature internal corner protectors to reduce risk of corner damage caused by dropped boxes.

Last time we had some production issues in some of the Kickstarter copies of Unfair. We rectified the issues and replaced cards and components for all the backers that requested them. It was a huge job but we are committed to providing quality games so we did everything possible to rectify the situation. 

But this time we have a longer checklist of things to TRIPLE check, and our factory has committed to improving their quality, and ramped up their Quality Control processes. We own our own card die now, and this is a simpler project. We won't be caught out again. 

If you find you still somehow need any replacement cards we do have some left. Get in touch so we can sort it out.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
We've heard all the questions about where Unfair is and we're here to let you know, as well as showing you some art from a coming expansion and showing off our shiny, shiny Unfair community! Let's jump in!
Where's Unfair?
In our last update, we said we were expecting Unfair to be in boxes and on the way to you by now. Then  Chinese public holidays, the Origins convention, the crush of production requests for Gen Con, an overcrowded warehouse, and juggling many logistical challenges amongst all that delayed the final certain assembly, and this update. As we have mentioned before we did a big reprint of Unfair to get it back into circulation with the expansion. That's been assembled for some time but we are assured that the Unfair ABDW Expansion assembly and mailer-boxing will be complete by July 5, ready to freight. We are arranging freight pickup for July 6, and it should be on the water to 4 different ports within a week of that at the most.  We will let you know when it is.

updates.update_userinfo: Production update & the most Unfair community

Word from our manufacturer is that production of the Unfair reprint and the ABDW expansion will be complete sometime next week. Soon after that they will be shipped by sea to the USA, Canada, the UK (EU) and Australia to begin regional fulfillment from those areas. Rest of the World fulfillment will be done from China and the UK. 
I'll have more information on expected delivery dates in subsequent updates. But rewards should ideally start arriving to backers by the end of July, and in some places earlier. In my experience, due to shipping times and methods, some rest of world backers (those in Asia) will likely receive them first, then Australians, Americans and Canadians, and finally Europeans and the rest of world backers fulfilled from Europe.

We have received several proof copies of the reprinted base game and the expansion. I'm pleased to report they are 95% perfect. However, one of the issues will delay production completion for a few more weeks.
Please keep in mind that we are printing large print runs of both the base game and the expansion. With over 1000 base game + expansion backers, we must ship and fulfill the expansion only copies and bundles together to meet the budgets that enable us to ship to most people for free. We are also printing a lot of extra copies of both the base game and expansion for retail. So these linked production runs are being treated as a huge print run together.

campaign.story:
Cthulhu: Death May Die is a cooperative board game for 1 to 5 players willing to take on the Cthulhu mythos like never before! Cultists are summoning one of the Elder Ones to consume our world, and it is up to the ragtag group of investigators to face the nightmarish forces and disrupt the ritual long enough to make the Elder One vulnerable. And then kill it dead.
Find out more about these Optional Buys in the following links: Season 2 Expansion, Black Goat of the Woods, Art Book, Extra Dice, Frost Dice.
Designed by Rob Daviau and Eric M. Lang, the game features monster artwork by Adrian Smith and investigator artwork by Karl Kopinski. Investigators come from all walks of life, each bringing a unique skill to the team, as well as two other generic skills.
Art by Karl Kopinski, sculpts by RN Estudio.
Madness is always at your side when battling unthinkable monstrosities from other dimensions. In fact, the investigators already start the game with a diagnosed insanity, which will will be triggered by your encounters with the occult. You may be doomed by your mental breakdown, or learn to use it to your advantage. The closer you are to losing your mind completely, the more powerful your skills will become.
Art by Filipe Pagliuso.
Summoning the Elder Gods are fanatic cultists, and the hosts of nightmarish monstrosities aiding  them in their cause. Each of these enemies possesses its own special ability and combat strength. They are not controlled by any player, but instead have their behavior triggered by Mythos cards used for each specific episode.
Art by Adrian Smith. Sculpts by Thierry Masson, Yannick Hennebo, Remy Tremblay, Michael Jenkins, Edgar Skomorowski, and Jose Roig.
The Death May Die core box contains smaller boxes that hold the modular elements to create each unique game session. Players choose one of the two available Elder Ones and combine their contents with those of one of the six available Episodes. Each of these boxes contain unique figures, tokens, and cards that are only used when playing with those elements. The Mythos deck used in each game is a combination of cards from the chosen Elder One box and the chosen Episode box. Each Episode not only indicates the map setup using the various tiles in the game, but also new actions the investigators can perform in order to accomplish the tasks required to disrupt that episode's ritual. They each also bring their own Discovery cards for players to explore, and the monsters' behaviors and abilities are tailored to each unique story.
Hastur, known as the King in Yellow, and his disciples brand the world with their terrible Yellow Sign. Those that suffer this doom quickly meet their fate by the hands of death or madness.
Art by Adrian Smith. Disciple sculpt by Thierry Masson. Hastur sculpt by JAG.
Cthulhu, The Thing That Should Not Be, will bring his sunken kingdom of R'lyeh into our world, plunging the earth into a nightmarish reality.
Art by Adrian Smith. Cthulhu sculpt by Michael Jenkins. Star Spawn sculpt by Aragorn Marks.
The Elder Ones start the game off the board; as they move along the summoning track their growing presence invites chaos and insanity into the world to accompany their grand awakening. Eventually they cross over and the real nightmare begins. If the investigators have managed to disrupt the ritual, the Elder One becomes vulnerable and may (just possibly) be killed for good. If not, the investigators now have to contend with an immortal behemoth hunting them while they try to accomplish their tasks. Either way, killing the Elder One will not be easy, not by a long shot, as each time it's bested it grows more enraged and powerful. In the end, either all investigators will fall or death will come for the Great Old One.
Investigators, Cultists, Star Spawn, Cthulhu and Hastur painted by Robert Karlsson. Byakee, Deep One, Ghoul, and Shoggoth painted by Fabrizio Russo. Cthonian, Fire Vampire, and Hunting Horror painted by Angel Giraldez. PLEASE NOTE FIGURES COME UNPAINTED.
In their mission to thwart the cultist's plans, investigators engage in more than combat. If they can get some respite, they can discover all sorts of things to potentially help them in their tasks. Discovery cards are unique to each Episode, and present the investigators with challenges or choices that will grant them different resources, companions or negative effects.
Cthulhu: Death May Die core box comes with:
45 Highly-Detailed Plastic Figures
17 Terrain Tiles
30 Plastic Tentacle Tokens
8 Custom Dice
5 Counter Bases
10 Investigator Dashboards
186 Cards
120 Tokens
1 Rulebook
WIP Rulebook
Please be aware that this is a Work In Progress Rulebook. It is not final. Rules may still be tweaked and changed, layout and graphics may still be altered. So, if you see anything in here that isn't the same later, understand that during the Kickstarter the project is still in development and all aspects are subject to improvements.
Unspeakable Pledge - $100
Backers with an Unspeakable Pledge will receive a copy of the Cthulhu: Death May Die core box, the Kickstarter Exclusive Investigator Julia, plus all applicable Stretch Goals.
Sculpt by RN Estudio. Painting by Robert Karlsson.
Julia is an incredibly level-headed investigator. Given the extraordinary circumstances she finds herself in, it's amazing how she can keep her wits about her. Her unique skill allows her to take wounds instead of stress, greatly increasing her chances of success in any given encounter. Though it may cost her life in the end...
R'lyeh Rising Pledge - $250
Backers with a R'lyeh Rising Pledge will receive a copy of the Cthulhu: Death May Die core box, the Kickstarter Exclusive R'lyeh Rising expansion, and the Kickstarter Exclusive Investigator Julia, plus all applicable Stretch Goals.
As the production of this statue is extremely expensive and time-consuming, delivery of it will be staggered. However, all backers will receive the rest of the base pledge at the same time. 
Check out THIS UPDATE for for answers to some pressing questions, extra gameplay information, and shipping cost estimates.
Let's not be coy, the heart and soul of the R'lyeh Rising expansion is its colossal figure of Cthulhu! This cyclopean creation is something never before seen in the world of board gaming. Its base is 44 x 44 cm wide, and it stands 57 cm tall to the tip of its wings. In fact, this thing is so huge that his base becomes the board on which the game is played! This plastic statue was sculpted in terrifying detail and will come pre-assembled, with the exception of the clip-on wings, so it can be proudly displayed for all to see.
Sculpt by Remy Tremblay (Julia figure included for scale).
R'lyeh Rising is a wholly unique Episode, the epic finale to Death May Die, not only bringing its own set of tokens, Discovery cards, Monster cards, and Mythos cards, but also drastic changes to the game's base rules, as the figures move and act freely upon the behemoth's rocky base.
Painting by Angel Giraldez (Cultist figures included for scale).
PLEASE NOTE ALL FIGURES COME UNPAINTED.

is an exclusive item for Kickstarter backers, with remaining stock available through conventions and special promotions only.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 32nd Kickstarter, and there are some vagaries in terms of timing when it comes to anything produced in China, such as: 
Production delays 
Shipping delays 
Customs delays

The estimated delivery date for this project is July 2019, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

We've done our best to minimize this as much as possible, and we are always happy to refund pledges if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all. Since the game is 90% complete, we don't believe this is in the least bit likely. We've successfully delivered Zombicide, Sedition Wars, Guilds of Cadwallon, Zombicide Season 2, Relic Knights, Rivet Wars, Kaosball, Dogs of War, Arcadia Quest, Wrath of Kings, XenoShyft, our Base System, Zombicide Season 3, The World of Smog: On Her Majesty's Service, Rum & Bones, Blood Rage, B-Sieged, Zombicide: Black Plague, The Others, XenoShyft: Dreadmire and Masmorra: Dungeons of Arcadia, Arcadia Quest: Inferno, Rum & Bones: Second Tide, Massive Darkness, The World of Smog: Rise of Moloch, Rising Sun, and Zombicide: Green Horde. A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game is currently shipping to backers.

We have three ongoing projects currently: HATE, Zombicide: Invader, and Arcadia Quest: Riders, which are in production.

Please refer to our individual project pages if you'd like to check the progress there. Each project is entirely independent from each other, has completely different development teams, and has no effect on the production flow or development of Cthulhu: Death May Die.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via Paypal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.

This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 8 week window has elapsed. Unconfirmed pledges make it difficult for us to plan production and logistics, and in the past have led to project delays. For this project we do not intend to allow this to happen, which may mean if you confirm your pledge too late, exclusive items may not be produced in sufficient quantity for your pledge.

If you confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Iä! Iä! Investigators fhtagn!
We hope that you're all safe and well. Since the delivery and release of Death May Die we have received incredible feedback and compliments on the game. A large portion of it comes, of course, from the amazing and diverse settings of the episodes that our Investigators have to face to outcome otherworldly evils, as well as the different set of characters and abilities.
CMON Comics - Volume 1

Iä! Iä! Investigators fhtagn!
As the year ends, so does delivery of Cthulhu: Death May Die. We've received confirmation that all packages have been sent out from all hubs, so any backers still facing any issues please contact support@cmon.com
We have been ecstatic by the overwhelmingly positive feedback we've been getting from players diving into Death May Die. The reviews have been very kind, and it's just great to know that all our efforts to craft this product paid off. In the spirit of the holiday season we'd like to thank all our backers for helping make this project a reality (and for the patience with the delays we faced). We hope you play many episodes during your break, and may you actually win once in a while!

Iä! Iä! Investigators fhtagn!
Deliveries of your pledges are on track to our last update. Here are the latest more precise estimates for when each Hub should send out the pledges to their backers:
 Asia Hub: Everything has already been sent out.
 Canada Hub: Already sending and should be done by November 15.
 Australia Hub: From November 18 to November 29.

Iä! Iä! Investigators fhtagn!
We've just been informed that things haven't moved exactly at the speed we expected, and we'll have to wait just a little bit longer to challenge the Great Old Ones. While we're confident some backers will still receive their pledges by the end of October, the bulk of deliveries should reach backers in November and into December. Please bear with us just a smidge more!

Iä! Iä! Investigators fhtagn!
Hope you're all having fun with your giant Cthulhu figures! (Yes, we know, it's bigger than you thought it would be) With the exception of a handful of stragglers, the big boy should have made its way to the hands of backers all over the globe. Not bad for something that was scheduled to finish delivering on April 2020!
Alas, every silver lining has a dark cloud. We've just been made aware that there will be some further delay in the delivery of the full Kickstarter pledges to backers. As it stands, backers should expect to start receiving their packages in late October and into November. We are truly sorry about this, as we know you are all anxious to test yourselves against the great Old Ones.

Iä! Iä! Investigators fhtagn!
When dealing with Elder Gods, time behaves in strange ways. The original plan for the R’lyeh Rising expansion (which includes the giant Cthulhu figure) was to ship it to backers in batches, with the first few lucky ones getting it in July 2019 and the vast majority of less fortunate souls getting it in staggered shipments until April 2020. Well, we are very happy to inform that things are looking better. Much better! Turns out that it won’t be necessary to ship this behemoth in small batches over a period of almost a year. No, in fact this will start being sent to right now, being delivered over a period of merely a couple of months!

Iä! Iä! Investigators fhtagn!
Today we'd like to show you the exclusive Frost Dice many of you added your pledge. It took us a few iterations to find the right formula for these dice. Get the black dice to show the frost effect while still being recognizably black. Get the right amount of transparency depth and subtle glittering to the plastic. In the end, we are very happy with the suitably otherworldly results obtained.

Iä! Iä! Investigators fhtagn!
We know it's been a while since the last update, and apologize for that.
While we faced no major hurdles, this project did prove to be quite a daunting one, with so many moving parts and new challenges we'd never faced before. Having so much of the game experience centered not on the core rules, but on what each Episode and Elder One brings to a session is certainly what makes this game shine, but it also means a LOT of work for every department. From custom-made rules to custom-made tokens, it's certainly been an epic journey!

campaign.story:
Please note: This campaign is in Australian Dollars (AUD). The prices are likely to be cheaper in your local currency. We have provided estimates in United States Dollars (USD).
FUNDED, THANKS EVERYONE! Late pledges available on BackerKit soon.
We are Campaign Coins. We make beautiful metal coins and tokens for tabletop games.  
We also love meeples. So, we thought... why not make some?
We asked our artist and game designer friend Daniel Solis to do the art (he likes meeples too). We then used the experience with industrial casting and antique metal plating which we have brought to all of our coins since 2007, and then spruced them up with the beautiful new enamels we started using in 2015.
And you know what? Even we're surprised by how hecking nice these are.
Meeple prototypes. They heart you.
We think they'll make you smile. You might fancy a special set for yourself (the red ones are pretty sweet). Perhaps you'll go full meeple and get a complete set of all colours to bling out every game in your collection. Maybe you'd just like a collector pack of one of each to line up on your desk to brighten each work day.
Because everybody loves meeples. Right? Right. We thought so.
The meeples are standard size: 16 mm (3/5 inches) from side to side, and the same from head to feet. They are 10 mm thick (2/5 inches).
They are die cast metal, with hand polished edges. We have given each meeple a unique antique metal finish. Each meeple also has its own pattern, which we have sealed with a different translucent colour enamel.
This means that when you are gaming, you can tell which ones are yours from whichever angle you look at them. From above, you can see the different metal, and face on, you can see the pattern or the colour.
Meeple prototype colour line up
Here are the combos you can see in the lineup photo above:
Red Hearts with Antique Copper
Yellow Daisies with Shining Gold
Green Bamboo with Antique Bronze
Blue Waves with Platinum
Purple Stars with Antique Silver
Black Skulls with Black Nickel
Antique plating prototypes, from left: Blue, Red, Green, Yellow, Black, Purple
The meeples stand up straight or lie down flat. And they are heavy! A single metal meeple weighs a hefty 11 grams (⅖ oz), ten times the weight of a regular wooden meeple.
If you look at them side on, you can see where we polish the joins. We finish them by hand, and we like the slight imperfection, they look more handcrafted than machined.
We hope the photos do them justice. They're just so pleasing.
How do you make a meeple?
Read about how the meeples came to be in Update #2
Read about how we refined the meeple designs in Update #4
Read about our bonus Mt Fuji meeple stretch goal in Update #5
For more meeple fun, see our #meepleholiday photo gallery.
Thanks: AUD $1 (~ USD $1)  
Thanks for your support! You'll get the updates and follow our progress. We'd give you a meeple high five too, but meeples don't have fingers.
Lucky Meeple: AUD $10 (~ USD $8)
We will send you a single Red Heart Meeple. No other Add Ons are permitted for this pledge, and there are no Stretch Goals for you sorry. Postage is included worldwide.
Meeple Pack (AUD $30 /~USD $23)
There are six types of Deluxe Metal Meeple. A Meeple Pack can be:
Red Colour pack: 8 Red Heart meeples with Antique Copper;
Yellow Colour pack: 8 Yellow Daisy meeples with Shining Gold;
Blue Colour pack: 8 Blue Wave meeples with Platinum;
Green Colour pack: 8 Green Bamboo meeples with Antique Bronze;
Purple Colour pack: 8 Purple Star meeples with Antique Silver;
Black Colour pack: 8 Black Skull meeples with Black Nickel; or

Collector pack: 6 meeples, one of each different colour (the whole meeple family).
To get more packs, increase your pledge. At the end of the campaign we will ask you in Backerkit which type you want for each pack you pledge for. The more packs you add, the better the price per pack. Please see the sidebar to the right for details of pricing. If you pledge for at least one pack, you qualify for all Stretch Goals.
Important note: Postage is extra, and is not included in your pledge level. Postage will be charged in Backerkit after the campaign funds. See Shipping, below.
Meeple Collector Pack, your new best friends. (Prototypes shown)
Making this many meeples is going to be plenty of work. So, we don't plan a deep amount of Stretch Goals, as we don't want to over extend and put any risk between you and these sweet new friends. But, we have planned a few little surprises for you along the way.
Happy Meeples: Project Funded! (AUD $5,000)
YOU DID IT! : We hit this target in 24 hours, we're going down to meeple town!  The project is funded, and we can make your meeples. Thank you so much.
Comfy Meeples: Velvet Bags (AUD $12,500)
YOU DID IT! : All sets of 8 meeples will come in a velvet bag of the same colour to keep them nice and snug. The collector set will come in a brown velvet bag so that you can tell them apart. Thanks for providing your meeples with a warm, dry home!
Bonus Mt Fuji Meeple (AUD $20,000)
YOU DID IT!: Daniel had an idea for a secret meeple, and we loved it. If we reach this goal, everyone who pledges for a Collector Pack or higher will receive a single Mt Fuji meeple in Shining Bronze. We will never this again with the same combo of colour enamel and antique finish. The only way to get this limited edition version is to pledge here. For more about this meeple, see Update #5.
Bonus meeple: Mt Fuji in dark blue with Shining Bronze
Artist Bonus (AUD $30,000)  
YOU DID IT! After the Bonus Meeple, we have no more physical stretch goals to offer, sorry. (Really. We're being careful, as we don't want to disappoint you by promising too much).
But gosh, we do want to share your generosity with the artist who made it all possible. So, we will pay a 50% bonus to the art fee we have already paid to Daniel Solis. You are all meeple royalty now!
If you would like Add Ons, please increase your pledge by that amount. We will check what you want and charge the correct shipping in BackerKit after the campaign ends.
Meeple Pack: AUD $30 (~USD $23): Either a Colour Pack of 8 meeples of the same colour, or a Collector Pack of 6 meeples, one of each colour.
Note, rather than buy this as an Add On, you will get much better value by increasing to a higher pledge level.
More than Eight Packs?
Wow, you really like meeples. Thank you! If you have gone for our TEN OF EACH or EIGHT PACK pledge levels, and still want more packs, then you get the special Add On price of AUD $22 (~USD $17) for each additional set you add on top of your Eight Pack pledge.
Note, you must be at the Ten of Each or the Eight Pack pledge levels to quality for this special price.
Single Meeples?
We are really sorry, but we cannot offer single meeple Add Ons, as the risk of error is too great. If this campaign is successful, we will offer single meeples on our website at a later date. We chose sets of 8 meeples as the most popular number, although we know that different games have different requirements. We hope you can understand our decision. We had to draw the meeple line somewhere.
King's Ransom Coin Set AUD $45 (~USD $35): This is a set of 50 of our high quality metal coins, great for use with any Euro-themed board game. The set contains 25 x Copper-1 coins, 15 x Silver-5 coins, 10 x Gold-20 coins, and a single Gold 10,000-coin to use as a first player marker, all in a red velvet bag. Note, the denominations on the coins are tiny, so you can ignore the numbers and change the values to suit different games. We are offering this Add On at a slight discount to our regular website price. For shipping purposes, the weight is the same as two meeple sets.
Our Board Games with Coins PDF lists the coins needed for popular board games.
That's All: We don't intend to offer any other Add Ons, because we want to make it smooth and easy to ship these to you. But, you can buy all of our regular range of coins right now at CampaignCoins.com
Campaign Coins are brought to you by King of the Castle Games. We are based in Melbourne, Australia. We were the first to bring metal coins to the board gamers and roleplayers way back in 2007, and then as now we manufacture them to the finest possible quality. Our coins and tokens look great, and are hard wearing. We want you to play with them for life.
In 2018 we will also start publishing our own line of card and board games, starting with Rochi, designed by James Ernest and Sonia Orin Lyris.
Please note: the pledge levels do not include postage. Like many other Kickstarter projects these days, we have decided to charge shipping in Backerkit after the campaign ends. This will allow us to give you the most fair and accurate shipping charge possible, based on the exact weight of your pledge, and the information at the time of shipping.
Orders from USA and Canada will be fulfilled from America.
Orders from Europe will be fulfilled from the EU. Customs duties will not apply within the EU.
Orders from Australia, New Zealand and Asia will be fulfilled from Australia.
We cannot accept pledges from South America. We're really sorry, but we don't currently have a fulfilment solution that offers you reasonably priced secure shipping. The meeples will be available from our website if this project is successful, and you can order then.
SHIPPING ESTIMATES
Here are our current estimates on shipping costs, based on the data we have right now. While we will be charging you in Australian Dollars (AUD), for clarity we have listed your local currency for shipping estimates:
Australia: One set AUD $3 | Five sets AUD $15
New Zealand: One set ~NZD $6 | Five sets ~NZD $23
Asia: One set AUD $6 | Five sets AUD $30
USA: One set ~USD $5 | Five sets ~USD $14
Canada: One set ~CAD $9 | Five sets ~CAD $26
United Kingdom: One set ~GBP £5 | Five sets ~GBP £10
EU: One set ~EUR €5 | Five sets ~EUR €12
Rest of World: One set ~EUR €6 | Five sets ~EUR €14
 For a complete photo gallery, please visit our Facebook photo album.
Deluxe Metal Meeple prototypes: Facebook photo album
Revised Flower Meeple design
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have been making coins since 2007, and this is our fifth Kickstarter. We have already made the molds for this campaign, and many samples to test the quality. We will air freight the production to our fulfilment partners. We anticipate no delays. 

We have backed over 400 projects, and we know what's important: communication, preparation, honesty, and regular updates. 

Should our schedule change, you'll be the first to know: we'll tell you what's happened, how long it will take to fix, what we're doing about it.
